bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Order Allowing Substitution of Bond
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Jung Him et al for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

It appearing to the court that on the 7th day of March, 1922, A.V.Williams of Seattle, Washington, filed herein and deposited with the Clerk a certain Liberty Bond, being No. 826392, of the Third Liberty Loan, for $1,000.00, conditioned as a recognizance bond for the release from custody of the above named Jung Him; and it appearing further to the court that said A.V.Williams now desires to withdraw said Liberty Bond and substitute in the place thereof a property bond signed by himself and wife, which bond is herewith presented to the court for filing herein, which said property bond has been approved by the United States District Attorney; and it appearing that said property bond, so to be substituted in place of said Liberty Bond, is in proper form; now

IT IS ORDERED, that the clerk of this court accept said property bond in lieu of said Liberty Bond, and that said Clerk return said Liberty Bond above described to said A.V.Williams, or to Peters & Powell, his attorneys, taking their receipt therefor.
DONE IN OPEN COURT THIS 24 DAY OF JUNE, 1922.
